name: Casa Loma
description: A Gothic Revival style mansion and garden.

name: St. Lawrence Market
description: A major public market building, known for its history.

name: Distillery District
description: A historic and entertainment precinct, home to many of Toronto's heritage buildings.

name: Royal Ontario Museum
description: Known for its wide range of natural history and world culture exhibits.

name: Art Gallery of Ontario
description: One of the largest art museums in North America.

name: Bata Shoe Museum
description: A specialized museum dedicated to the history of footwear.

name: High Park
description: Toronto's largest public park featuring many hiking trails, sports facilities, a beautiful lakefront, and a zoo.

name: Toronto Islands
description: A chain of small islands in Lake Ontario, offering beaches, parks, and recreational activities.

name: Edwards Gardens
description: A former estate garden featuring perennials and roses on the uplands and wildflowers, rhododendrons, and an extensive rockery in the valley.

name: CN Tower
description: A renowned tall tower and communications and observation tower.

name: Rogers Centre
description: A multi-purpose stadium with a unique retractable roof.

name: Toronto-Dominion Centre
description: A landmark complex of skyscrapers in downtown Toronto.

name: The Entertainment District
description: Known for theaters and performing arts centers.

name: Scotiabank Arena
description: A multi-purpose indoor arena, home to sports events and concerts.

name: Harbourfront Centre
description: A key cultural organization on the downtown waterfront of Toronto, hosting a variety of arts and cultural events.

name: University of Toronto
description: Known for its historic architecture and a robust collection of libraries and museums.
